headline.print_headline: Where Pilgrims Landed, Thanksgiving Is Kept at Table, Not Mall
headline.seo: Blue Laws Curb Consumerism Where Pilgrims Gave Thanks
headline.main: Where Pilgrims Landed, Thanksgiving Is Kept at Table, Not Mall

docs.snippet: Some of the country’s retailers said they would move up sales to Thanksgiving Day, but stores in some New England states, adhering to those states’ “blue laws,” will be closed Thursday....
docs.abstract: Some of the country’s retailers say they will move up sales to Thanksgiving Day, but stores in some New England states, adhering to those states’ 'blue laws,' will be closed on the holiday; nationwide, a protest is developing against Thanksgiving Day sales, with workers at some stores threatening to strike, saying holiday openings disrupt family time.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the country’s retailers said they would move up sales to Thanksgiving Day, but stores in some New England states, adhering to those states’ “blue laws,” will be closed Thursday.

headline.print_headline: With D’Antoni as Coach, Gasol Will Be on the Move, Beyond the Arc
headline.seo: Lakers’ Pau Gasol Will Be Relocated, Beyond the Arc
headline.main: With D’Antoni as Coach, Gasol Will Be on the Move, Beyond the Arc

docs.snippet: Under the spread-the-floor offense of Mike D’Antoni, the Lakers’ new coach, Pau Gasol will drift more toward making long-range shots....
docs.abstract: Arrival of Los Angeles Lakers new coach Mike D'Antonio has forward Pau Gasol working on his adaptive skills; D'Antonio says he will count on Gasol, who has generally been a reliable midrange shooter, for 3-pointers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Under the spread-the-floor offense of Mike D’Antoni, the Lakers’ new coach, Pau Gasol will drift more toward making long-range shots.

headline.print_headline: Parents and Teachers Are Forced to Scramble With School Vacation Days Lost
headline.seo: With Loss of School Vacation Days in New York, Parents and Teachers Are Forced to Scramble
headline.main: Parents and Teachers Are Forced to Scramble With School Vacation Days Lost

docs.snippet: The New York City Department of Education and union leaders announced they had canceled three days of the February break, leading parents and teachers to cancel vacations, rearrange home swaps and negotiate with airlines....
docs.abstract: Parents and teachers have been scrambling to cancel vacations, rearrange home swaps and negotiate with airlines following New York City Education Dept decision to cancel three days of the February 2013 break; plan is an attempt to make up for school days lost after Hurricane Sandy.

byline.original: By JENNY ANDERSON and KYLE SPENCER

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York City Department of Education and union leaders announced they had canceled three days of the February break, leading parents and teachers to cancel vacations, rearrange home swaps and negotiate with airlines.

headline.seo: How to Fix a Broken Election System

docs.snippet: President Obama and Congress can make voting easier for all Americans and reduce the role of big money....
docs.abstract: Editorial outlines ways in which Pres Obama, Congress and state and local governments should reform nation's broken electoral system; calls for making it easier to vote, removing barriers to voting, and lists measures that will curb influence of unlimited, secretive campaign contributions to outside groups.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama and Congress can make voting easier for all Americans and reduce the role of big money.

headline.print_headline: San Francisco Officials Approve a Ban on Public Nudity
headline.seo: San Francisco Officials Vote to Ban Public Nudity
headline.main: San Francisco Officials Approve a Ban on Public Nudity

docs.snippet: An ordinance was introduced after the number of habitual nudists increased and residents and business owners complained....
docs.abstract: San Francisco Board of Supervisors votes 6 to 5 to approve ban on public nudity following an increase in the number of habitual nudists in the city and a rise in complaints; decision provokes heckling and boos from protesters, many of them nude.
docs.lead_paragraph: An ordinance was introduced after the number of habitual nudists increased and residents and business owners complained.

headline.print_headline: Clashing Views on Israel and Gaza
headline.main: Clashing Views on Israel and Gaza

docs.snippet: Sampling the outpouring of responses to developments in the Middle East....
docs.abstract: Alan Dershowitz letter comments on Nov 20 editorial about Hamas's culpability in instigating Gaza war.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sampling the outpouring of responses to developments in the Middle East.

headline.print_headline: Turkey Finds It Is Sidelined As Broker In Mideast
headline.seo: Turkey, With Anti-Israel Stance, Sidelined as Mideast Broker
headline.main: Turkey Finds It Is Sidelined as Broker in Mideast

docs.snippet: Turkey has found itself largely shut out of the central and defining Arab-Israeli conflict in Gaza....
docs.abstract: Turkey's anti-Israel stance has undermined its ability to play role of regional power broker in Middle East by leaving it with little leverage to intercede in Gaza conflict and forcing it to take back seat to Egypt on stage of high diplomacy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey has found itself largely shut out of the central and defining Arab-Israeli conflict in Gaza.

headline.seo: Duty Before Party for Gov. Chris Christie

docs.snippet: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey received the ridicule of fellow Republicans because he stood up for his state and praised President Obama after Hurricane Sandy....
docs.abstract: Editorial scores Republicans who have criticized New Jersey Gov Chris Christie for praising Pres Obama's handling of Hurricane Sandy and its aftermath; applauds Christie for standing up to his party's worst elements and putting his welfare of his state over blind party loyalty.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey received the ridicule of fellow Republicans because he stood up for his state and praised President Obama after Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: Ravens’ Ed Reed Fined for Late Hits
headline.main: Ravens’ Reed Fined for Late Hits

docs.snippet: Baltimore Ravens safety Ed Reed avoided a one-game suspension for late hits after an appeal. He instead will be fined $50,000....
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Pittsburgh Steelers, desperate for receivers, bring back wide receiver Plaxico Burress; other football developments noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Baltimore Ravens safety Ed Reed avoided a one-game suspension for late hits after an appeal. He instead will be fined $50,000.

headline.print_headline: Members of the 112th Congress Depart, Taking Their Quirks Along
headline.seo: Members of the 112th Congress Depart, Quirks in Tow
headline.main: Members of the 112th Congress Depart, Taking Their Quirks Along

docs.snippet: From Senator Richard G. Lugar’s foreign policy expertise to Senator Kent Conrad’s bichon frisé, the expiring Congress has left its mark in ways large, small and weird....
docs.abstract: More than 80 members of the 112th Congress depart, over half of them involuntarily, leaving behind a varied legislative record and a host of memorable personality quirks.
docs.lead_paragraph: From Senator Richard G. Lugar’s foreign policy expertise to Senator Kent Conrad’s bichon frisé, the expiring Congress has left its mark in ways large, small and weird.
